TopicTitle: What happened to Hitchhiker IVA? Parts in the Trailer?

Articles.Content:
I remember seeing this image of the hitchhiker crewtank IVA being teased at us.

What happened to it?

Also, what are those parts in the trailer, and why weren't they included in this update? The wheels on the rover looked very nice, and there was a camera looking object on it too.
I was looking forward to that as well. ~ very disappointed.
I would think they are waiting till they develop EVA in IVA, if you know what I mean.

I would think they are waiting till they develop EVA in IVA, if you know what I mean.

<wink>. Yes I do.

I would think they are waiting till they develop EVA in IVA, if you know what I mean.

Yo dawg, I heard you like VA's, so we put an EVA in your IVA so you can EVA while you IVA.

1 whole cabinet just for toothbrushes?

I think the ADA would love Kerbal Dedication to Oral Hygiene

It'd be great to float around in that thing while I'm on my way to the mun..

Also.. how cool would it be if u could play games with other kerbals? A little table could slide out... "Anyone up for some hold'em? Got about 3 hours before orbital insertion."

1 whole cabinet just for toothbrushes?

I think the ADA would love Kerbal Dedication to Oral Hygiene

Well, kerbals appear to be about 5% teeth by mass
What are they going to do with all that junk, all that junk inside that trunk?

I would think they are waiting till they develop EVA in IVA, if you know what I mean.

So, your suggesting we conduct our extravehicular activity...

inside the vehicle?

BRILLIANT!
Aw, I also wanted to see the Hitchhiker IVA, the cupola module still compensates for that tho
I actually sent kerbals up to my space station to test it out. Shame it wasnt implemented though :( :( look at all of these upset kerbals

It'd be great to float around in that thing while I'm on my way to the mun..

Also.. how cool would it be if u could play games with other kerbals? A little table could slide out... "Anyone up for some hold'em? Got about 3 hours before orbital insertion."

This. Is. Awesome.

Post it in dev suggestions ASAP.

Seriously.
It'd be neat if they switched to jumpsuits with your flag on them as well, like they do on the ISS.

Aw, I also wanted to see the Hitchhiker IVA, the cupola module still compensates for that tho

Yea. I really love that cupola module!
I'm confused as to why it wasn't implemented in the first place.
They've been sitting in a corner collecting dust while .20 was developed, I guess they were just forgotten about.
probably wasn't quite ready, probably issues

They've been sitting in a corner collecting dust while .20 was developed, I guess they were just forgotten about.

Well, with multiple thousands lines of code going our to public consumption, I can't imagine how something could be missed!
Will they be implemented in 0.20.1? That would be awesome.
Is it me or is the Cupola cockpit rather small. It is nice though.

They've been sitting in a corner collecting dust while .20 was developed, I guess they were just forgotten about.

0.20.1 Maybe? And the parts in the 0.20 release trailer, are they real parts or just for the sake of being an apollo-accurate Mun buggy for the trailer?

Is it me or is the Cupola cockpit rather small. It is nice though.

it is. I was rather hoping it would be a bit more like the original panopotican or whatever it was called in kspx pack... That that I'm complaining. I can just reinstall that and have a one man and a 3 manned pod, as it is my favourite cockpit Ive come across yet

I think it would be awesome to be able to move the navball and controls out of the way in the Cupola, like right-click and select "Toggle Dashboard" or similar. I know Squad has some further plans for IVAs, but I think this would be seriously cool. Perhaps objects like windows and hatches could be operated like this too.

I'm hoping they go back and revisit the earlier command modules, I still can't see out of the in-line canopy or the shuttle cockpit. Also, they need snacks.

Edit: A reduction in the glare on the 2-man landercan navball would also be a nice quality of life improvement.
